job_description:
Commit Works
is an expanding technology company preparing for significant growth over the coming years. We’ve been on a focused journey to strengthen our foundations so we can scale rapidly — and now we’re ready.
This is an exciting time for us, and a great time for you to join.
Our enterprise-grade software suite enables efficient planning, tracking, and execution of operational activities in one integrated platform. Used across five continents, our solutions unlock rapid and sustainable performance improvements for operational teams. Our customers include some of the world’s leading resource companies, including Anglo American, BHP, Rio Tinto, and others.
We are now looking for an
Implementation Specialist
to join our Customer Delivery team and support the deployment of our software across mining operations. This role suits someone early in their career who enjoys technology, customer interaction, and hands-on field work — and who wants to build a meaningful career in operational technology.
About the Role
As an Implementation Specialist, you’ll play a hands-on role in ensuring our software is successfully deployed, adopted, and embedded at mining operations. You’ll work closely with experienced Project Managers and cross-functional delivery teams, gaining exposure to real-world project environments and learning how technology is operationalised on-site.
This role offers a mix of collaborative office-based work and meaningful field time, where you’ll help frontline users understand and adopt the software in their day-to-day workflows. It’s a role well suited to someone who enjoys variety, problem-solving, and building strong working relationships.
Key Responsibilities
Implementation & Project Support
Support the planning, scoping, configuration, testing, training, and go-live activities of customer implementation projects.
Contribute to documentation, status reporting, and testing artefacts to ensure transparency and traceability.
Customer Engagement (On-Site & Remote)
Work directly with frontline users to understand operational workflows, supporting operational readiness.
Represent the Delivery function as a key contributor to customer satisfaction and adoption success.
People & Organisational Change Management
Support customer readiness activities by assisting in training, communication, and user adoption efforts.
Promote end-user engagement and readiness as a core outcome of every implementation.
Continuous Improvement
Share customer insights and project learnings to strengthen Delivery and Product practices.
Support a culture of collaboration, accountability, and operational excellence.
What You’ll Bring
Essential
Strong communication and stakeholder engagement skills
Ability to work confidently on remote mining or industrial sites
Basic understanding of project delivery concepts
Tech-savvy with strong documentation and organisation skills
Proficiency with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel, PowerPoint)
Nice to Have (Not essential — we’ll train you)
Experience in mining, industrial operations, or operational tech
Experience in software implementation and/or technical support
Exposure to SaaS environments and enterprise systems
Interest in change management, user training, and customer success
Curiosity about future pathways such as Project Management, Customer Success, Product or Technology
What’s in It for You
Career growth and structured development
Training and mentoring from experienced delivery professionals
Chance to work with Tier 1 mining organisations across the globe.
The opportunity to grow as the business scales globally
A great culture - we're a diverse group, coming from many different countries and blending industry veterans with energetic young talent. We love to deliver for our clients, and we like to have fun doing so.
Ready to build a career where technology meets real operational impact?
We love passionate people with lots of drive - if that's you, we'd love to hear from you - even if you don't tick every box!

Sage Intacct Implementation Specialist – Work From Home
Are you an accounting and systems professional with a passion for delivering high-quality ERP implementations? We are seeking a Sage Intacct Implementation Specialist to join our growing team, working from home while supporting not-for-profit organisations as they transform their financial management through a leading cloud ERP platform. The role will focus primarily on implementation, with some ongoing support responsibilities included.
About Us
At Giuntabell, we inspire the charity and not-for-profit community to reach their full potential. With extensive experience across the sector, we work closely with organisations to understand their finance and technology needs, delivering ethical, professional and measurable outcomes. Our team partners with clients to implement and support sector-specific financial systems that help communities thrive.
The Role
As a Sage Intacct Implementation Specialist, you will lead clients through the full implementation lifecycle, ensuring they achieve a smooth transition to their new ERP system. You will also contribute to post-go-live support, helping build confidence and capability within the system. Working remotely, your responsibilities will include:
Leading Sage Intacct implementations from discovery and requirements gathering through to configuration, testing and deployment.
Working closely with clients to understand their financial processes and tailoring Sage Intacct to meet organisational needs.
Collaborating with internal team members to ensure projects are delivered on time and to a high standard.
Providing clear and engaging client training and documentation to support successful adoption.
Assisting with data migration activities, including mapping, validation and reconciliation.
Offering post-implementation support, including troubleshooting, guidance and minor configuration adjustments.
Staying current with Sage Intacct features, enhancements and industry trends to provide informed advice and best practice recommendations.
About You
We are looking for a self-driven professional with strong accounting knowledge and hands-on experience in system implementation. You will have:
Experience in implementing Sage Intacct (preferred), experience with other cloud-based ERP/accounting systems will be considered.
Tertiary qualifications in accounting, finance, information systems or a related field.
Strong understanding of accounting principles, with the ability to translate business processes into system configurations.
Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication skills, with confidence delivering training and engaging with stakeholders at all levels.
The ability to work independently in a remote environment, while remaining connected and collaborative with the wider team.
Benefits
Work from home, with flexibility and support to succeed remotely.
Professional development pathways, including Sage Intacct training and certification.
The opportunity to contribute to meaningful change in the not-for-profit sector.
A supportive, values-driven team environment.
Engagement across a diverse client base and a rapidly expanding ERP practice.
How to Apply
If you are an experienced systems professional ready to lead impactful Sage Intacct implementations, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your interest in the role and your relevant experience.
Join us in empowering not-for-profit organisations with exceptional financial technology and delivery expertise.

Curiosity about future pathways such as Project Management, Customer Success, Product or Technology

Career growth and structured development
Training and mentoring from experienced delivery professionals
Chance to work with Tier 1 mining organisations across the globe.
The opportunity to grow as the business scales globally
A great culture - we're a diverse group, coming from many different countries and blending industry veterans with energetic young talent. We love to deliver for our clients, and we like to have fun doing so.
Ready to build a career where technology meets real operational impact?
We love passionate people with lots of drive - if that's you, we'd love to hear from you - even if you don't tick every box!

classification: Veterinary Services & Animal Welfare (Farming, Animals & Conservation)
job_description:
The Role
We are a global animal health technology and services company dedicated to advancing the world of veterinary medicine. We have a long history of innovation, continuous improvement, and excellence in customer service to our vet and veterinary practice clients.
We are entering an exciting phase as we continue to roll out our new cloud-based Practice Information Management System to our valued vet clinic customers and are seeking an Implementation Specialist to join our Eight Mile Plains based team. You will be responsible for delivery all software solutions to new and existing customers through effective customer consultation and education.
If you are a Vet, a Practice Manager, a Veterinary Nurse or from this much-loved industry and you are ready for a change, then we want to hear from you. This role will leverage your excellent customer service skills, allow you to build rapport with clinics, and support those who care for our furry friends. You don't have to be a tech expert, but you understand how to utilise tech to transform how a clinic operates and can guide change effectively.
Your main responsibilities will be;
Delivery of new clinic installation, data conversation, configuration, module installation, training, consultation and database work for specified veterinary clinics.
Implementation and project management of new ‘sites’, including scoping out of delivery timelines, software installation, data conversion, configuration, training and assistance during ‘Go Live’.
Ensuring Customer Success is achieved through effective consultation, escalation and troubleshooting of issues.
After-implementation software solution installation including add-ons, new module installation, hardware replacement etc.
Tailoring training to customer requirements through webinars, workshops, online training content (both to internal team members and directly to customers).
Ensuring customer feedback is provided back to internal teams so that necessary changes can be considered and implemented across products and features.
Delivering product demonstrations to highlight functionality to new and existing customers.
About You
To be successful you will have;
Demonstrated experience within the Veterinary industry, including the understanding of daily operations in a clinic or hospital environment, and the needs of our veterinary clients.
Previous experience using veterinary software is advantageous including but not limited to VisionVPM, RxWorks or Ascend as well as a passion for technology and how to use technology to enhance clinic efficiencies.
Professional presentation and communication skills and a demonstrated ability to build relationships with a diverse range of internal and external stakeholders.
A self motivated and autonomous approach to planning your work.
Experience educating, inspiring, and leading customers through product adoption and change.
Highly organised, strong time management to manage customer priorities and follow through.
Tertiary qualifications in Business and/or Technology (preferred though not essential).
Why Join Us?
At Covetrus, we’re proud of our family friendly culture and respectful workplace. We embrace diversity in our workforce and encourage applications from like-minded persons from all walks of life. Covetrus team members are eligible to access a suite of fantastic benefits, to help them look after themselves, their family and their beloved pets. These include –
Generous discounts on our range of animal health food & enrichment products
Access to Perkbox/Boost apps for discounts on everyday shopping & amazing health & wellbeing resources.
Additional leave benefits – annual birthday leave, paid parental leave, & the option to purchase additional leave
Flexible hybrid Work From Home options & dog-friendly offices (select roles and locations)
Free 24/7 access to our Employee Assistance Program
Reward & recognition through our bi-annual Values Awards and our Service Anniversary Awards
Professional development through our Leadership Development & Emerging Leadership courses
Access to annual flu vaccinations
Annual volunteer days

classification: Networks & Systems Administration (Information & Communication Technology)Government - State (Government & Defence)
job_description:
The role
The Application Specialist will provide customer focussed seamless, end-to-end integration of all of the ICT services necessary to deliver to defined service levels, the enterprise information systems required for clinical and administrative functions across Queensland Health.
Key responsibilities:
Provide effective change management, capacity planning, incident management, risk management and continuity planning utilising best practices in systems support and service delivery, within the ITIL framework
Ensure end to end service delivery for enterprise systems within Queensland Health by establishing and maintaining highly effective working relationships with other technical specialists, application specialists, vendors and end users
Provide timely application support activity reports to stakeholders
Assist in the ongoing development, maintenance and deployment of application specific guides, work instructions and technical documents.
About you
We are searching for someone who:
Demonstrated ability in the provision of specialist advice on, and support for the Hospital Based Corporate Information System (HBCIS) including a working knowledge and understanding of the different modules and how they fit together.
Demonstrated ability in developing and promoting ITIL Service Management processes, primarily incident/problem/test/change and configuration management.
Demonstrated ability to ensure that service delivery meets agreed service levels in a customer focused ICT environment.
Well-developed interpersonal, written and oral communication skills including the ability to negotiate, advise, influence others and work collaboratively with people to make decisions.
Well-developed ability to build and maintain appropriate relationships with team members, other technical specialists, application specialists, vendors and end-users.
Previous clinical health application support experience preferred.
Why work with us?
Work alongside passionate professionals in a supportive and inclusive environment that values people and prioritises employee success and wellbeing. This includes
Competitive salaries
12.75% superannuation
17.5% leave loading
Employee wellbeing
38/36.25 hour full time work week
Access to 24/7 confidential employee support providers and counsellors including for immediate family members
Additional flexibility to support your work life balance including access to generous leave entitlements, such as purchased leave, domestic violence leave, reproductive health leave, cultural leave, study and examination leave.
Professional development
Career progression with more than 300 diverse career pathways and career support to take you further!
Access to a variety of programs and initiatives to support training and career growth.
Grow your skills through hands-on experience and access to internal training opportunities and additional financial and leave benefits for approved external training and development.
Our commitment to equity, diversity and inclusion
At Queensland Health, our work environment is inclusive and supportive, and we value our employees. We are an equal opportunity employer and encourage applications from people of all cultures, abilities and backgrounds.
Our commitment to cultural safety, equity, diversity and inclusion means we understand some people may need changes to the recruitment process. If you need support during the recruitment process, such as meeting with the panel virtually instead of in person, please reach out to the hiring manager. We value diverse candidates and your need for adjustments will not affect our hiring decisions.
Ready to apply?
For further information on how to apply please review the attached Role Description.

Role Summary
The Client Delivery team at FINBOURNE works directly with our pre and post sales clients (who range from small start-up hedge funds and investment mangers to large superannuation funds) to understand their business problems and use cases. They then combine this with a detailed understanding of our products to help clients to make the best use of the opportunities offered by LUSID and Luminesce. Client Delivery is also involved in buildouts of client-specific capability and integrations, working directly with client stakeholders.
We are looking to hire an experienced Implementation Consultant to join our growing team in Australia; someone who is adept at explaining product features to clients, helping these clients with their implementations, together with building client-specific implementations. In this role you will have the opportunity to make key contributions to the future of the product and shape how our clients interact with LUSID. Our aim is to provide a world-class client experience; therefore, we are looking for a candidate who has a relentless focus on customer service and a desire to deeply understand client issues.
This role involves monthly inter-state travel to visit clients. In addition, it is important to note that although this role is based in Australia, the Product and Engineering teams are primarily based out of London, United Kingdom. This role therefore requires working across timezones which sometimes involves meetings in the early evenings in Australia.
Key Responsibilities
As part of the Client Delivery team at FINBOURNE you will be working alongside our clients and our Product and Engineering teams to help our clients to make the best use of our LUSID and Luminesce products
Regular interactions with our client’s project teams to support their implementation and delivery timelines
Explaining the product to clients, crafting solutions using LUSID, delivering technical content, system configuration and training
Workshop solutions and document requirements to support FINBOURNE’s Product and Engineering teams to understand feature requests and support specification and testing of new functionality
Liaising with Delivery Managers to provide estimates and scope to build coherent and deliverable implementation plans
Contribute to client deliverables and documentation
Skills and Experience
This role is well suited to an experienced Technical Business Analyst who is wanting to progress into a client-facing, hands-on delivery position where they can own the full solution lifecycle.
Experience and familiary with financial investment products and data feeds is desirable e.g. FX Forwards, Options, Futures, Bonds, Swaps etc.
Comfortable interacting with RESTful web based APIs using tools such as Swagger or Postman.
Proficient in data formats such as JSON, CSV and XML.
Technical skills in SQL and Python or other technologies are required for this role.
Just some of our benefits
At FINBOURNE we offer a supportive environment to build your career with continuous learning and development opportunities. We have a collaborative culture of testing and exploring problems together to find the best evidence-based solutions. Some of the benefits of working at FINBOURNE include:
Competitive salary plus performance based bonus.
Hybrid working: We have a mature attitude towards hybrid working.
Professional learning and development: External training and accreditations as well internal training and development programmes.
Paid maternity, paternity and adoption leave
About FINBOURNE
We are a young, dynamic financial technology company aiming to re-engineer the world of investing to make it clearer, faster and more cost effective for everyone.
At FINBOURNE, we offer a hugely supportive environment to build a career, with continuous learning and development opportunities. We have a collaborative culture of testing and exploring problems together to find the best evidence-based solutions. We respect your independent thought, your intellectual curiosity and your opinion.
Our solution is open, API first and developer friendly – a true first for the asset management industry. You can see what our team is busy building on Github.
For more information about us please visit our website.

Location:
Remote / Hybrid
Employment Type:
Contract 3 months
Department:
Technology / Operations
About the Role
We are seeking a highly skilled
HubSpot Implementation Specialist
with strong capabilities in
web portal development
and
database management
to support our digital transformation, CRM optimisation, and customer-facing platform requirements.
This role will be responsible for the full lifecycle of HubSpot implementations including configuration, automation, integrations, reporting, and workflow optimisation while also contributing to the development and maintenance of web portals (customer portals, partner portals, internal tools) and managing the underlying data structures that support business intelligence and operational efficiency.
You will partner closely with Sales, Marketing, Client Delivery, and IT to ensure that systems are scalable, integrated, and delivering measurable outcomes.
Key Responsibilities
HubSpot CRM & Marketing Automation
Lead end-to-end
HubSpot CRM implementation
, setup, and onboarding across Marketing, Sales, Service and Operations hubs.
Configure and optimise
workflows, automation, lead scoring, lifecycle stages, deal pipelines, ticketing systems, and custom objects/reporting
.
Develop dashboards, custom reports, and attribution models aligned with business KPIs including use of PowerBI and/or Tableau.
Manage data migration into HubSpot, ensuring accuracy, structure, and validation.
Integrate HubSpot with third-party systems (API, Zapier, native integrations, webhooks, MobileForce, TechOne).
Conduct training for internal teams to drive adoption and best practices.
Web Portal Development
Design, build, and maintain
client-facing and internal web portals
using HubSpot CMS, React, or other selected frameworks.
Develop secure login environments, user dashboards, document repositories, and workflow tools.
Collaborate with UI/UX designers to create intuitive, responsive, and high-performing interfaces.
Implement portal analytics, performance monitoring, and continuous improvements.
Database Management & Systems Architecture
Maintain and optimise structured datasets across HubSpot, SQL/NoSQL environments, and integrated platforms.
Establish and enforce
data governance standards
including naming conventions, deduplication processes, segmentation strategy, and backup rules.
Build and maintain ETL pipelines to ensure data flows seamlessly between systems.
Support BI/reporting tools and ensure data quality for executive insights.
Conduct regular audits to ensure data integrity, security, and compliance.
Required Skills & Experience
3–5+ years experience in
HubSpot implementation
, configuration, and automation (certifications highly regarded).
Strong understanding of inbound marketing principles, sales processes, and digital workflows.
Experience with
web development technologies
such as HTML/CSS, JavaScript, HubSpot CMS, React, Node.js or similar frameworks.
Solid background in
database management
, including SQL, NoSQL, ETL, and API-based integrations.
Demonstrated experience integrating SaaS platforms (HubSpot ↔ ERP, CRM, LMS, Payment gateways, etc.).
Ability to translate business requirements into scalable technical solutions.
Excellent communication skills for working with cross-functional teams and providing user training.
Desirable but not essential
Experience with
MobileForce
, Salesforce, Zoho, or similar platforms.
Familiarity with
Azure, AWS, or Google Cloud
architecture.
Exposure to Power BI, Tableau, or equivalent analytics tools.
Experience in industries requiring workflow automation, compliance tracking, or client lifecycle management (e.g., professional services, emergency management, healthcare, construction, engineering).
Personal Attributes
Highly organised, process-driven, and detail-oriented.
Strong analytical mindset with a passion for solving complex system challenges.
Self-starter capable of managing projects end-to-end.
Collaborative and comfortable working in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
What We Offer
Opportunity to lead HubSpot transformation across multiple business units.
Work with modern technologies and build meaningful digital experiences.
Competitive salary package with room for skill expansion and career development.
Flexible work arrangements and supportive team culture.

MEX Maintenance Software is an Australian-made Computerised Maintenance Management System (CMMS) based in Brisbane. For over 30 years, MEX has helped asset-intensive businesses manage maintenance, assets, and inventory efficiently. Now part of the TMA Systems global portfolio, MEX is entering an exciting growth phase with the release of MEX 16 - a next-generation cloud-based solution.
We’re looking for an experienced and customer-focused Implementation Consultant / Trainer to join our Consulting Team. This role is ideal for someone who enjoys guiding customers through software adoption, solving real business problems, and helping them get the most value from their MEX system.
About the Role
As an Implementation Consultant, you’ll lead customers through the full implementation lifecycle from discovery and configuration to training and go-live. You’ll act as a trusted advisor, helping businesses align MEX with their operational needs and build best practices for maintenance management.
You will:
Collaborate with customers to understand business goals and translate them into practical MEX configurations.
Lead online and face-to-face training sessions for users at all levels.
Guide customers through implementation, data migration, and system setup to ensure a smooth go-live.
Facilitate check-ins and customer status meetings to track progress and resolve issues.
Develop and maintain strong relationships with customers, ensuring adoption and satisfaction.
Provide feedback to improve training materials, product functionality, and onboarding processes.
Identify opportunities for process improvement and value-add across the customer journey.
Document configurations, procedures, and customer requirements.
Skills and Experience
Required:
2+ years’ experience in software implementation, consulting, or training (preferably CMMS or ERP systems).
Strong understanding of maintenance, facilities, or asset management workflows.
Excellent communication and presentation skills with the ability to simplify complex concepts.
High attention to detail, organisational skills, and ownership of deliverables.
Comfortable managing multiple customers and projects simultaneously.
Desirable:
Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, IT, or Business (or equivalent practical experience).
Experience with MEX, TMA, or similar CMMS solutions.
Experience facilitating workshops and customer onboarding projects.
Proficient with SQL, report writing, and general software administration.
What We Offer
Opportunity to work on a global software platform with a strong Australian legacy.
Exposure to a wide range of industries and customer environments.
Supportive culture that encourages growth, learning, and innovation.
Work Environment
Brisbane-based hybrid role (office and remote work).
Occasional domestic and international travel may be required.

job_title: Strategic Transformation and Implementation Specialist | PMO
job_description:
Initial contract to start ASAP until 27/02/2026 with likely 6-mth extension option paying from $108/hr
Brisbane CBD Location with flexibility to WFH 2 days per week
Develop a practical and phased implementation plan for the transformation roadmap and BTP
Our client, a large complex State Government Department, are currently seeking a Strategic Transformation and Implementation Specialist for an existing program of work to uplift capability across their portfolio of infrastructure capital works projects.
Following the development of a divisional Business Transformation Plan, this role will be required to support the implementation of the plan and will be responsible for:
Translating the Business Transformation Plan (BTP) into a Transformation Roadmap with clear dependencies and deliverables.
Leading initiative prioritisation activities to ensure resources are focused on the highest-value outcomes.
Establishing processes and frameworks to assess, sequence, and monitor transformation initiatives, projects and programs.
Supporting governance and reporting to track progress against the BTP.
The successful candidate in this role will collaborate with stakeholders across the Division to assess current prioritisation practices, define fit-for-purpose criteria and processes, and support the development of tools to improve transparency, alignment, and value-for-money in investment decisions.
The purpose of this role is to support the Transformation Management Office (TMO) in the rollout of the transformation roadmap aligned with the approved Business Transformation Plan (BTP). The role will focus on developing a comprehensive implementation plan, including governance structures, tools, and templates that enable effective delivery, oversight, and reporting of transformation initiatives.
The Strategic Transformation and Implementation Specialist will:
Planning and Implementation
Develop a practical and phased implementation plan for the transformation roadmap and BTP.
Develop a detailed action plan to operationalise the roadmap, including accountabilities, owners, and timeframes.
Define milestones, deliverables, and interdependencies across initiatives.
Identify interdependencies and gaps in the current transformation portfolio, to ensure delivery of strategic objectives.
Support the TMO in ensuring the plan aligns with strategic priorities, governance processes, and available resources.
Governance and Frameworks
Design and implement governance frameworks to support effective decision-making and accountability.
Establish tracking and reporting mechanisms to monitor implementation progress, dependencies, risks, issues, and benefits realisation and ensure alignment with divisional and departmental priorities.
Support the TMO in preparing materials for governance committees (e.g. Steering Committee).
Tools, Templates, and Processes
Develop a suite of fit-for-purpose tools, templates, and processes to support consistent program and project management across initiatives (e.g. dependency maps).
Standardise documentation, reporting, and communication to improve clarity and efficiency.
Create easy-to-use guides or playbooks for business owners and initiative leads.
Stakeholder Engagement and Support
Work closely with initiative leads, program officers, and business areas to ensure tools and frameworks are understood and applied.
Build strong relationships across the division to encourage adoption of consistent practices.
Transfer knowledge/ Produce and hand over a toolkit to the permanent TMO staff to support sustainability
Assurance and Risk Management
Establish clear risk and issue management processes to support proactive identification and resolution.
Ensure alignment with audit, compliance, and departmental standards.
Provide assurance to executives that the implementation approach is robust, realistic, and monitored.
Qualifications and experience
Strong knowledge and experience in program/project management methodologies (e.g., PRINCE2, MSP, P3O, Agile).
Proven ability to develop and implement governance frameworks and tools in a transformation environment (including development of prioritisation frameworks).
Demonstrated skills in change management, stakeholder engagement, and communication.
Proven experience in strategy implementation, business transformation, or program/project management.
High proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite (Word, Excel, PowerPoint, Project, SharePoint).
Experience in the public sector or large, complex organisations (desirable).
To submit your application, in strict confidence,
please submit your resume in
Word Format
using the appropriate link quoting reference
No. 247450.  Should you require further information please email
kristy.coulter@hudson.com
Your interest will be treated in the strictest of confidence.
Diversity, Equity & Inclusion at Hudson
Hudson is committed to helping you find a workplace where you feel respected, supported, and free to thrive. We welcome applications from all backgrounds, identities, and lived experiences—because when different voices come together, amazing things happen
.
Casual Loading
Please note for all
Australian
based contract and temporary roles only, the pay rate is inclusive of mandatory 25% casual loading. This excludes permanent and fixed term roles.

job_title: Real Estate Client Training & Implementation Specialist
job_description:
Client Training & Implementation Specialist – Commercial Property Management Software
Our Company
Rex Cirrus8 is an Australian owned, cloud based commercial property management software company. We pride ourselves on pushing boundaries, questioning past practices, and delivering best practice solutions to the Commercial Real Estate industry.
For more than 9 years, Rex Cirrus8 has been a trusted, fast-growing market leader in the multi-billion-dollar real estate sector across Australia and New Zealand.
Due to rapid national growth, we are seeking an experienced Real Estate professional looking to move into a training-focused role, or an experienced Software Trainer ready to join our friendly, results-driven Training and Onboarding team.
About the Role
This hands-on
Client Training & Implementation Specialist
role gives you the opportunity to work with a wide range of Commercial Real Estate clients across Australia and New Zealand.
You will be the central point of contact during onboarding, training new clients on our cloud-based platform, guiding them through each step of implementation, and ensuring they feel confident and supported. You will also provide initial support to new users and assist with product demonstrations when needed.
Duties
Tasks will include but are not limited to:
• Training clients on Rex Cirrus8 either online or in person
• Guiding new clients through the onboarding process and project managing each stage
• Providing initial support to clients as they begin using the system
• Completing online demonstrations of the software for prospective clients
• Maintaining strong communication throughout the onboarding journey
• Updating training materials and resources when required
About You
To be successful in this role, you should:
• Be an experienced Real Estate professional or Software Trainer
• Have prior experience using or understanding property management software (Cirrus8 experience is highly regarded)
• Thrive working autonomously across multiple onboarding projects in a fast-paced environment
• Display excellent presentation skills and communicate clearly and professionally
• Remain calm, patient, and solutions-focused under pressure
• Be able to explain complex concepts in a simple, client-friendly way
• Be IT savvy and enjoy assisting clients as they learn new systems
• Possess a strong work ethic and a willingness to pitch in to support team goals
Highly regarded experience and qualifications:
• Experience training or onboarding clients
• Understanding of Property Management and/or Trust Accounting
• Project management skills
• Exposure to the Commercial or Residential Property Market
Why Join Rex Cirrus8?
• Fast-growing SaaS company with a strong industry reputation
• Collaborative, supportive team culture
• Variety in your day working with diverse clients across Australia and New Zealand
• Opportunities to grow your career within a scaling business
• Flexibility and ongoing learning and development

Join #TeamPossible at Endeavour Foundation
Drive Change. Create Impact.
Endeavour Foundation is one of Australia’s largest employers of people living with disability.  Our people live and breathe our purpose every day, with flexible working, great perks, and work/life balance. We are dedicated to creating an inclusive culture where our employees can grow, learn, and do their best work. Our purpose is simple: make possibility a reality.
Endeavour Foundation’s Work Business Unit - 25+ manufacturing and production processing sites is undergoing a major transformation to create sustainable, inclusive employment opportunities. We’re seeking a
Transition & Implementation Manager
to lead complex change management initiatives across these sites.
What you’ll do:
Lead end-to-end change management for systems, processes, and people.
Design and implement transition plans for multiple sites.
Guide cross-functional teams through transitions with minimal disruption.
Monitor progress, manage risks, and deliver within budget.
Build strong stakeholder engagement and foster a culture of collaboration and resilience.
Report on transition progress, risks, and outcomes to key stakeholders.
Ensure compliance, safety, and alignment with Endeavour Foundation values.
Monitor progress, manage risks, and deliver within budget.
What we’re looking for:
Proven experience in change management - leading large-scale, multi-site transitions.
Background in manufacturing, production processing, or industrial operations (quality, compliance, supply chain, process optimisation).
Strong stakeholder engagement and communication skills.
Skilled in problem-solving and translating complex change into clear messaging.
Ability to manage costs, financial planning, forecasting, risk management, and make rapid decisions in dynamic settings.
Benefits and Perks:
Salary Package up to $15,900 of your annual salary tax free, and additional $2,650 for meal and entertainment expenses
Hybrid working environment, WFH flexibility.
Onsite Parking and Café in Support Office
Use your pre-tax income to purchase a new or used car, saving on both the purchase price and running costs via a Novated Lease through Salary Packaging.
Discounts on Corporate Private Health Insurance, selected Kia vehicles and white goods at Harvey Norman
Discounted family gym memberships through Fitness Passport
Supportive induction and learning opportunities, with Reward and Recognition Program
6 weeks paid parental leave for primary carer
Free coaching and counselling through our Employee Assistance Program.
Why join us?
People with lived experience of disability or those caring for someone with a disability are strongly encouraged to apply - your experience is valued here. Endeavour Foundation is proud to promote diversity and inclusion across age, nationality, culture, ability, and identity - including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, CALD communities, LGBTQI+ people, and others. We’re committed to making our recruitment process accessible and supportive to all applicants.
Intrigued? We’d love to hear from you.
Please click "apply" to submit your application.
For more information, contact Whitney P.
07 3900 5600

job_title: Business Partner and Product Configuration Specialist
job_description:
Allianz Group is one of the most trusted insurance and asset management companies in the world. Caring for our employees, their ambitions, dreams and challenges, is what makes us a unique employer. Together we can build an environment where everyone feels empowered and has the confidence to explore, to grow and to shape a better future for our customers and the world around us.
We at Allianz believe in a diverse and inclusive workforce and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer. We encourage you to bring your whole self to work, no matter where you are from, what you look like, who you love or what you believe in.
We therefore welcome applications regardless of ethnicity or cultural background, age, gender, nationality, religion, disability or sexual orientation.
Great to have you on board. Let's care for tomorrow.
JOB DETAILS / ROLE PURPOSE
Role Location: Brisbane - Work from Home 2-3 days and be in the Head office in Brisbane
Reporting to the Business Partner & Product Configuration Manager, the Business Partner & Product Configuration Specialist is responsible for the timely and accurate delivery of Business Partner & Product Configuration activities including but not limited to client, agent and agency setups for all lines of business for Australia and New Zealand. In addition to BAU activities, the role will be heavily focused on supporting projects with data entry, system testing and other activities to meet requirements.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES
Deliver and Support Daily Business Partner & Product Configuration Activities
Work collaboratively with external customers and stakeholders to accurately deliver partner, client and agency set-ups, updates and changes as required
Maintain the team inboxes to ensure all enquiries are addressed in accordance with Service Level Agreements (SLAs) and oversight is maintained of work in progress
Deliver on high volume requests such as International Health (IH) requests, Roadside Assistance (RSA) dealer and vehicle updates, and Electronic Manual (EM) administration requests.
Manage Fulfilment activities including content approvals and liaising with mail house to ensure partner correspondence is set up, changed and running effectively
Contribute to the development, review and continuous improvement of all processes and associated documentation to ensure control strengthening across the team
Actively identify and manage risks and issues ensuring these are escalated for resolution when appropriate
Customer Service and Stakeholder Management
Ensure that all stakeholders are clear on the tasks and timelines for delivery required from them to support onboardings, off boardings and changes on time and to the required standards
Provide an exceptional customer experience for both internal and external stakeholders with a solution focused approach to all requests and tasks
Proactively anticipate customer and stakeholder needs, providing status updates and seeking feedback to continuously improve support provided
Promptly resolve customer and stakeholder complaints in a sustainable way to ensure key learnings are captured and acted upon
Workflow and Reporting
Ensure all onboardings, maintenance activities and off boardings are delivered to agreed process timeframes
Effectively prioritise activities and workflow to ensure timely support is provided to internal and external customers
Fulfill regular reporting requirements on activities to provide valuable information to internal and external customers and stakeholders
Project Contribution
Provide support to the wider business by contributing to programs of work and projects
Contribute to critical project delivery activities on behalf of the Business Partner & Product Configuration team including, but not limited to, data entry, system updates and system testing
PROFILE KEY REQUIREMENTS
Knowledge and Experience
The ability to quickly learn and apply systems knowledge is essential
Experience using MIDAS, JIRA and Confluence is desirable
A strong understanding of the Allianz Partners business and our partners is desirable
Organisation and Time Management
Displays excellent attention to detail and accuracy, and has the ability to analyse information to identify problems and develop appropriate solutions
Demonstrates strong organisational and reporting skills, maintaining continual control over the job duties delegated
Demonstrated ability to work under pressure including the ability to achieve outcomes, prioritise work, meet deadlines, and retain personal motivation and tolerance.
Professionalism and Problem Solving
Proven high level of professionalism, maturity and candour in daily work ethic.
Ability to use judgement, initiative and common sense to solve problems and find solutions
Ability to think laterally and manage required systems and processes holistically
Customer Service and Team Work
Demonstrates customer focus, and possesses the energy and tenacity required to succeed in a challenging and rewarding environment
Proven ability to work effectively as part of a team supporting others to achieve team orientated outcomes
Demonstrated ability to operate autonomously using initiative, sound reasoning, listening and decision making skills.
Ability to effectively communicate both verbally and in writing with people at all levels of the business
Ability to manage and influence stakeholders effectively to ensure effective delivery of outcomes
82680 | Risk Management | Professional | Non-Executive | Allianz Partners | Full-Time | Permanent

Help shape the future of innovation at Suncorp. Contribute to transformative programs and enjoy career growth in a dynamic, supportive environment.
This is an 11 month contract role.
About the Role
Join our Innovation and AI Adoption Team to deliver programs, workshops, and experiments that enable Suncorp to adapt and thrive. You’ll support strategic initiatives, apply innovation frameworks, build AI experiences, and collaborate with stakeholders to create meaningful change.
What You’ll Do
Deliver innovation and AI events, workshops, and experiments that drive customer-focused outcomes
Organise and facilitate programs using Suncorp’s innovation processes and toolkits
Help to ensure the integration of AI into the innovation process, and training programs
Collaborate with internal teams and external partners to ensure successful delivery of initiatives
Contribute to the design and testing of prototypes for new experiences, services, and products
Advocate for innovation culture by promoting creativity, collaboration, and experimentation
What You’ll Bring
Tertiary qualifications or equivalent experience in a business-oriented discipline
2+ years in corporate innovation, learning, or customer experience
Hands-on experience with innovation tools and techniques such as design thinking, agile, or lean
Strong facilitation and presentation skills with the ability to engage diverse stakeholders
Curiosity, adaptability, and a growth mindset to explore emerging opportunities
An interest in the usage of AI
What You’ll Enjoy
Access our award-winning Shine platform – your central hub for exclusive perks, wellbeing support, career development, and recognition. Shine has been recognised for excellence in employee experience, making it easier than ever to access what matters most to you.
Hybrid working, flexible leave, 20 weeks paid parental leave, and up to 5 days paid flexible leave annually
Paid study support, career breaks, on-the-job learning, and a $1,000 referral bonus for eligible employees
Free wellbeing coaching, a dedicated Employee Council, and confidential EAP access
Discounts at 400+ retailers, insurance savings, gym memberships, and reduced super fees
Paid volunteer leave, donation matching, and unlimited emergency response leave
Performance-based bonuses and Suncorp shares for eligible employees
Diversity is celebrated through employee resource groups and inclusive policies for all families
Explore our full benefits: www.suncorpgroup.com.au/careers/benefits
At Suncorp we believe we are our best when our workforce is as diverse, talented and passionate as the communities in which we live and operate, and where our people feel included, valued and connected. We are passionate about inspiring our people by creating a diverse, accessible, and inclusive culture, offering flexible work, career development and internal mobility, and building connected relationships amongst our team members and with our customers.

job_title: Scheduling and Operations ( MUST HAVE CEC )
job_description:
One Solar Australia is a family owned Solar and Battery company. Currently operating in both NZ and throughout Australia.
With the business experiencing rapid growth we require the services of an enthusiastic candidate who is effective at organising and coordinating schedules, has a keen eye for detail and can provide support above expectation.
About the Role
This exciting role reports directly to the Install manager and will liase with the sales team too.
As a Scheduling and Project Coordinator, you will be responsible for managing solar, battery, and energy-efficiency installation projects from the moment a contract is signed through to final job completion. You will ensure that projects are delivered efficiently, on time, within budget, and to a high standard of customer satisfaction.
The role acts as the central hub across departments and stakeholders—including customers, installers, sales reps, subcontractors, and internal teams coordinating communication, stock readiness, scheduling, compliance, and post-installation service.
We welcome applications from candidates who have experience in scheduling or service coordination. Whilst this is preferred, we are also keen to hear from candidates who are digitally savvy, can quickly learn new concepts and are keen to work in a dynamic, fast-evolving industry with opportunities to grow.
What you'll do:
Manage the full installation lifecycle in our CRM ( PIPEDRIVE )—including tech checks, approvals, scheduling, and completions
Coordinate our own in house install teams, subcontractors, and equipment across multiple regions
Be the main point of contact for customers, ensuring a smooth and informed experience
Handle changes, reschedules, and day-to-day coordination of stock and installer availability
Liaise with internal teams (sales, procurement, compliance, grid connection, offshore support)
Ensure documentation, compliance, and STC submissions are accurate and timely
Keep projects on track—on time, within budget, and with minimal return-to-site issues
To be considered for this position, you should have the following expertise:
Proven experience in scheduling, service coordination or administration
Confident communicator who thrives in a fast-paced, customer-focused environment
Highly organised with strong attention to detail and a proactive approach to problem-solving
Able to juggle competing priorities while keeping things moving
Tech-savvy—comfortable using CRMs, compliance platforms, and task management

company_name: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
job_description:
Market Rates
Brisbane Based
12 Month Engagement
A leading local government organisation is seeking an experienced
Program Technical Lead
to support a large-scale transformation program spanning HCM/HR/Payroll, Safety, Customer, Assets and Works Management systems.
This role sits within a major multi-year program of work and will drive solution architecture, integration design, and technical delivery outcomes across multiple projects. You'll work closely with project managers, vendors, and internal technical teams to ensure solutions are scalable, secure, reliable, and aligned with enterprise standards.
Key Responsibilities
Provide high-level technical leadership, guidance, and advice across the program and to senior stakeholders.
Oversee solution architecture and integration design, ensuring alignment with business requirements, IT strategy, and industry best practice.
Lead and coordinate technical activity across vendors, service providers, and internal technical teams.
Act as the single point of contact for all solution and integration design decisions.
Manage technical risks, issues, and solution-related decision-making.
Ensure appropriate governance across design, development, testing, change, deployment, and transition to operations.
Drive the development of sustainable, scalable, and reliable integration approaches.
Ensure delivery of high-quality technical documentation, including build guides, recovery docs, support materials, and end-user documentation.
Provide oversight and input across technical testing, test planning, and execution.
You will have:
Proven experience developing and integrating enterprise systems in complex environments.
Strong working knowledge of integration patterns, architecture principles, and technical governance.
Demonstrated experience leading technical teams and managing vendor delivery.
Understanding of regulatory requirements such as privacy, risk, and security.
If this is something you'd like to be considered for click APPLY NOW or contact David at david.reynolds@talentinternational

Position : Operations and Project Coordinator (Full Time)
Location: Cannon Hill, QLD 4170
Company: Customology Pty Ltd
Website: www.customology.com.au
At Customology, our purpose is to help our clients create customers for life. We advise clients on their customer growth, customer value, and customer retention strategies, and work collaboratively with different teams, stakeholders, and their agency partners, to deliver the best outcome for the customer. We are seen by our clients as specialists in customer lifecycle strategy, and pride ourselves on our customer first thinking.
The Client Support Administrator will manage all client support inquiries, triaging them by addressing immediate needs and directing complex requests to appropriate channels. Additionally, they will oversee the scheduling of all client work through operations platform whilst maintaining clear communication to any related stakeholders.
Key Responsibilities
Workflow & Priority Management - Respond to operational inquiries within agreed timeframes, triaging and escalating as required. Plan, prioritise, and schedule work, adapting to changing priorities.
Standards & Structure Enforcement - Ensure adherence to organisational standards and tools. Lead ISO 27001:2022 compliance and promote consistent standards, structures and processes across the business.
HR Onboarding & Offboarding Processes - Coordinate onboarding/offboarding for operations staff, maintaining checklists and compliance with standards.
Client Onboarding & Offboarding - Support smooth client transitions, tracking progress and ensuring all required actions are completed.
Company-Wide Communications - Maintain proactive, transparent communication with stakeholders and support COO-led communication initiatives.
Project Management Oversight - Collaborate across teams to deliver projects, monitor risks, and track progress against timelines and resources.
Capacity Tracking & Reporting - Track resource capacity, identify efficiency improvements, and prepare regular reports for the COO.
Customer Support - Provide timely and professional support to clients, addressing inquiries, resolving issues, and escalating where required. Monitor support trends to identify recurring issues and recommend process or system improvements.
What we’re looking for:
Customer Service Excellence
: Ability to provide outstanding internal stakeholder support and maintain strong working relationships.
Communication Skills
: Clear and concise communication, both written and verbal, to interact with colleagues, leadership, and external contacts.
Organisational Skills
: Strong ability to prioritise tasks, manage time efficiently, and handle multiple priorities simultaneously.
Problem-Solving & Decision-Making
: Capability to assess needs, troubleshoot issues, make decisive decisions, and resolve resourcing conflicts with minimal impact.
Attention to Detail & Multi-tasking
: Thoroughness in handling requests, scheduling accurately, and adjusting priorities as necessary.
Team Collaboration
: Willingness to work collaboratively with other departments to ensure operational and business needs are met efficiently.
Adaptability
: Flexibility to adjust to changing priorities, demands, and operational procedures.
Technical Proficiency
: Familiarity with workflow and project management tools (e.g., Jira, Confluence, Tempo, Slack, Google Suite) and the ability to quickly learn new systems and processes.
As an award winning agency, Customology is proud to work with some of Australia’s leading brands – helping them keep their customers for life! Our clients include Suncorp, Bridgestone, Laser Clinics Australia, Specsavers, Jimmy Brings, Soul Origin, Healthia and many more.
Learn more: www.customology.com.au
To Apply
If this sounds like the perfect role for you, please click the APPLY button to send a:
Short cover letter that highlights your suitability for the role.
Resume outlining your previous experience, skills and qualifications.
Salary range is based on experience on "What we are looking for" area which is between $70,000 - $85,000 plus Superannuation.
Please note only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.
You must have the
right to live and work
in this location to apply for this job

Head Of Transformation Delivery Office
Drive Enterprise-Wide Transformation for Care and Community!
Lutheran Services
is seeking a visionary
Head of Transformation Delivery Office
to lead enterprise-wide programs across business change and technology supported by a strategic program and project management office. This is a rare opportunity to shape the future of care delivery through disciplined execution, integrated governance, and capability uplift.
Location:
Support Centre, Milton
Employment Type:
Full-Time (mainly office-based with some WFH flexibility)
Remuneration:
$220K + Salary Packaging + Benefits
About the Role
Reporting to the
Executive Director – Enterprise Transformation
, this role leads a high-performing team across three core verticals: Strategic Program Management Office (SPMO), Business Change Programs, and Technology Programs. You will drive transformation delivery, uplift organisational capability, and ensure alignment with Lutheran Services’ strategic growth agenda.
In this role, you will:
Lead the development and maturity of the enterprise-wide SPMO
Oversee cross-functional transformation initiatives including service model redesign and workforce uplift
Direct delivery of enterprise-wide technology programs (ERP, CRM, digital enablement)
Embed governance, assurance, and risk management across all transformation initiatives
Build and lead a high-performing team of program managers and delivery professionals
Support executive and board-level reporting on transformation progress and value
About Us
Lutheran Services is a not-for-profit organisation that has supported Queensland communities for over 90 years. We deliver aged care, retirement living, home care, and community services including mental health, disability, youth and family, and domestic and family violence support.
We are entering an exciting growth phase, with a strategic plan to double the number of people we serve in the next five (5) years. Our mission is to perfect the art of quality care where everyone belongs, has purpose, and shares joy every day. This role will play a pivotal role in driving our growth agenda.
About You
You live our values of
Kindness, Empowerment, Innovation, and Integrity
. You are a driven leader with deep experience in transformation delivery, ideally in the NFP sector. You thrive in complex, multi-stakeholder environments and bring a values-aligned, collaborative approach to leadership.
You will have:
Proven experience leading enterprise-wide transformation or portfolio delivery
Expertise in PMO/SPMO development and governance frameworks
Strong track record in business change and technology program delivery
Experience in executive-level reporting and strategic decision-making
Outstanding stakeholder engagement and leadership skills
Desirable: Experience in aged care, community services, or NFP sector; certifications in project/change management
Why Choose Us?
Lead an ambitious and a high-impact transformation agenda in a values-driven organisation
Be part of a 90-year legacy of care and community service
Salary packaging up to $15,900 to increase your take-home income
Exclusive discounts – AIA Health, AGL, Pest Audit, The Cosmetics Company & more
Apply Now!
Please attach your resume and complete the application form and questions below.
Applications close: 11 Jan 2026.
For more information, view the
position description here.

job_title: Principal Technology Officer - Devices, ieMR Program
classification: Programme & Project Management (Information & Communication Technology)Government - State (Government & Defence)
job_description:
Digital Metro North (DMN) works collaboratively with clinical leads and end users across Metro North Health to deliver the Digital Metro North Strategy 2018-32. The strategy aims to ultimately deliver an integrated digital hospital and healthcare environment across Metro North by 2032. Over the coming years, significant capital works are being undertaken, including hospital construction and refurbishment and the implementation of the ieMR Advanced solution across all Metro North facilities. Achieving the aims of the strategy requires a dedicated team with the knowledge, determination, and skills to deliver quality results.
Key knowledge and experience
The ideal applicant will be able to demonstrate the following:
Provide expert support in the installation, maintenance and support of non-enterprise hardware, peripherals, software and computer systems either in a standalone or networked environment.
Provide detailed technical support by trouble-shooting non-enterprise hardware, software, telecommunications and other media problems or by offering advice and education to clients on how to use local equipment and systems operating within Metro North Health. Highlight potential problem areas and assist the ieMR Program and Digital Operations team to maintain a high standard and reputation.
Maintain relationships with and between internal and external stakeholders, ensuring effective communications and foster relationships through lessons learned, feedback mechanisms and management of expectations supporting the ieMR Program, Technical Customer Support team and Digital Operations.
Ability to quickly establish professional relationships with other members of the ieMR Program, eHealth Queensland DPT, Digital Operations teams, other DMN teams, and with DMN clients.
About the role
This role is full time with the standard hours of operation being 8:00am – 4:06pm, Monday to Friday.
Flexible working arrangements such as variable working hours, working from home and flex accrual may be supported.
There are opportunities for coaching, development, and career progression within the broader ieMR Project team.
The role is based at Campbell Place, directly opposite the Royal Brisbane and Women's Hospital
Find out about the role in more detail and how to apply in the attached Role Description and Program Overview
Benefits when working for us
Rewarding career and development opportunities across a wide range of clinical and non-clinical areas.
Value driven organisation which provides a work environment that is safe, satisfying, flexible, and promotes a healthy work-life balance.
Flexible working arrangements and competitive salary rates with annual incremental increases.
Benefit from a higher than standard employer contribution to Superannuation of up to 12.75% and access to salary packaging.
Be part of a world-class, dynamic and growing health service that embraces technology and innovation, excellence in healthcare, quality teaching and cutting-edge research. Metro North Health is committed to providing a diverse and inclusive workplace for all employees. We offer unique and rewarding professional development opportunities in a safe and flexible work environment with a focus on putting our people first. You can find out more about why it's so great to work at Metro North here:
https://metronorth.health.qld.gov.au/careers
.

AI gives our people more time to care, connect and change lives.
At Trilogy Care, we’re changing aged care for good-not with more paperwork, but with smarter, faster, AI-supported ways of working that put clients and employees first. With organisation-wide access to AI tools and strong leadership support, every team member is empowered to embrace new ways of working. By lifting the burden of admin, AI is helping us make workdays more human-not less. If you’ve ever wished for more time with clients and less time on documentation, you’ll find a future-focused care team here that’s ready to back you all the way.
The opportunity
As our
Innovation & Transformation Lead (Operations & Assurance)
, you’ll play a critical role in improving operational efficiency, strengthening compliance and risk visibility, and delivering practical innovation through AI and technology. This is a hands-on role for someone who identifies process optimisation opportunities, ships improvements, influences across teams, and builds consistency in a complex operational environment.
What you’ll deliver
Improved experiences
for our clients, business partners and employees.
Uplift complaints and feedback handling
to improve triage, quality, and consistency.
Increase operational efficiency
across targeted workflows across our third-party supply chain, reducing friction and improving scalability.
What you’ll do
Legislation & Compliance
Maintain strong working knowledge of the Support at Home regulatory environment (highly regarded, not essential).
Proactively identify operational risk and support practical compliance uplift.
Project Leadership
Own end-to-end project plans for regulatory and operational change.
Align policies, process, systems and stakeholder engagement to deliver outcomes.
Lead change management, risk mitigation, reporting and documentation.
Operational & Commercial Excellence
Analyse and redesign workflows to improve efficiency, quality and consistency.
Implement sustainable improvements that support growth and margin optimisation
Innovation & AI Integration
Identify opportunities to centralise data across departments and leverage emerging technologies and AI across workflows.
Represent operational priorities to the Data & AI team and help drive adoption.
Stakeholder Engagement
Build strong relationships across departments to achieve common goals.
Communicate requirements, innovations, and implementation plans effectively to internal and external stakeholders.
What you’ll bring
Must-have
Proven experience delivering operational optimisation, innovation and transformation outcomes.
Excellent stakeholder influence and communication.
Strong analytical and procedural mindset and comfort navigating complexity and ambiguity.
Practical AI fluency: uses AI tools to accelerate quality, consistency and delivery.
Bonus Points
Experience in aged care, health, or other regulated environments.
Technical experience with systems (e.g., CRM, workflow tools, data platforms).
Why Trilogy Care?
Expansive new King Street office close to transport, cafes and amenities
Vibrant culture and regular social events
Career mapping and progression opportunities
Salary packaging to boost your take-home pay
Fitness Passport, EAP for you and immediate family
Employee discounts (groceries, fuel, utilities, wellness and more)
As our Innovation and Transformation Lead (Operations & Assurance), you’ll help shape a future where AI gives care teams more time to connect, clients more personalised support, and the aged care sector a smarter path forward.If you're passionate about operational excellence, inspired by the potential of technology, and ready to make a meaningful difference, we’d love to hear from you.
Please note
To join our team, you’ll need to have full Australian work rights. As part of our standard recruitment process, we’ll also conduct a working rights check, police check and request professional references during onboarding.
We appreciate the interest of recruitment agencies but kindly ask that resumes not be submitted unless a prior agreement is in place. Trilogy Care will not accept responsibility for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

job_title: General Manager - Client success & Research Transformation
job_description:
Endpoint IQ is a Brisbane-based SaaS company working with universities, research institutes, and health services across Australia, New Zealand, and overseas. Our platforms streamline the end‑to‑end research management pipeline, so researchers spend less time on admin and more time on impact.
We’re looking for a solutions‑focused, personable leader for our Client Success and Implementation team. We’re a medium‑sized, specialist team with low ego, a collaborative style, and close relationships with our clients. With the pace of change across higher education, this role is ideal for someone who wants to help shape the next generation of research management systems while staying connected to the sector.
You will:
Lead a multidisciplinary team of project managers and product specialists (~12FTE) delivering multiple concurrent implementations (10–24 month programmes)
Bring research management expertise to challenge "lift and shift" processes and design better ways of working for our clients
Own our implementation framework and delivery standards across institutions in Australia and overseas
Ensure Level 2 application support and product-specialist knowledge flow cleanly through to our developers and support engineers
Support Sales with research-literate input to proposals and take part in pre-sales demos for new and upsell opportunities.
About you
You understand the research management ecosystem and how universities and health services actually get work done. You may have come up through a Research Office, Ethics and Governance, Grants, or Graduate Research, or you may have led delivery or support for research‑adjacent software. What matters most is practical experience helping researchers and professional staff navigate processes such as ethics review, grants and contracts, HDR candidature, or post‑award finance, and turning that understanding into reliable delivery, clear communication, and measurable outcomes.
You’ve worked across multiple stakeholder groups and are comfortable balancing day‑to‑day matters with the dynamics of multiple streams of project delivery. Whether your path has been operational within a research intensive organisation or product/delivery for a vendor you will bring credibility with research management professionals and the judgement to lead a team that’s close to clients and outcomes.
What you’ll bring
Meaningful experience in research management or a closely related domain, with fluency in processes like ethics/governance, grants and contracts, HDR/GR, or post‑award.
A track record delivering or supporting business systems, ideally SaaS.
Strength in stakeholder engagement across academic, professional, and IT groups, with clear, plain‑language communication.
Comfort moving between detail and big picture: from root‑cause analysis and SOPs to roadmap, prioritisation, and acceptance.
Team leadership that’s low‑ego, collaborative, and oriented to service quality and measurable client outcomes.
Why join Endpoint IQ
Stay adjacent to higher education and research while broadening into the tech sector
Work with multiple large orgnisations and see your ideas postitively influence practice across the sector
Join a supportive, close-knit team where your voice matters and bureaucracy is light
Work based in Toowong, with practical flexibility and occasional travel to clients and overseas conferences
Real opportunity to shape how research is managed during a time of major change in the sector.

Position
- Full-time, fixed-term contract until 30 June 2026 (with potential to extend)
Location
- Cannon Hill (Hybrid Role)
Salary
- $110,000 pa + Super + Salary Packaging Benefits
Endeavour Foundation is one of Australia’s largest employers of people living with disability. Our people live and breathe our purpose every day, with flexible working, great perks, and work/life balance. We are dedicated to creating an inclusive culture where our employees can grow, learn, and do their best work. Our purpose is simple: make possibility a reality.
Make an Impact!
We are seeking an experienced and motivated
Governance, Assurance & Improvement Specialist
to lead and manage continuous improvement initiatives within our Service Delivery functions, including Client Services and Client Support teams. Reporting to the Head of Business Excellence, this pivotal role is based at the Endeavour Foundation Support Office in
Cannon Hill
. You will partner with leadership teams to operationalise and embed changes that drive superior client outcomes, enhance operational efficiencies, and contribute to the financial sustainability of the organisation.
Your role will be critical in identifying, prioritising, and delivering business improvement initiatives, while ensuring that improvements lead to better outcomes for people we support. You will also drive cultural change, manage complex stakeholder groups, and lead teams to deliver high-impact results.
Key duties of this role are to:
Identify and prioritise key improvement opportunities, driving change across Service Delivery teams to enhance client experiences.
Partner with leaders to support the implementation of improvement initiatives that align with strategic goals and improve operational efficiency.
Actively drive cultural transformation and embed business improvement practices across teams.
Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to gain support and ensure the successful delivery of initiatives.
Ensure initiatives comply with relevant legislation, policies, and frameworks, including safety, quality, and safeguarding.
Use an evidence-based approach to prioritise and implement initiatives, providing regular reporting on progress and outcomes.
Guide teams and leaders through change management processes, mentoring them to successfully adopt continuous improvement practices.
To succeed in this role, you will have:
Tertiary qualification in human services, business, project management, or a related field (desirable).
Previous experience in a business improvement or governance role, with a proven track record of delivering operational improvements and driving change.
Strong analytical, problem-solving, and stakeholder management skills. Familiarity with the disability services sector and NDIS is a plus.
Demonstrated experience in leading teams and influencing the organisation to adopt business improvement programs.
Proven experience in implementing change initiatives and using structured project management methodologies.
Excellent written and verbal communication skills to engage with stakeholders at all levels.
You will be required to undertake a
“Fit2Work” National Criminal History Check
and hold or be willing to obtain a Blue Card and NDIS Worker Screening Check.

Salary Packaging Benefits! Package up to $
15,900
of your annual salary tax free.
In addition to your tax-free benefit, you can also use up to $
2,650
of your pre-tax income to pay for entertainment expenses (meals, holiday accommodation etc).
An Employee Assistance Program - a free and confidential counselling service available to all staff and their family members.

Paid Parental Leave.
Reward and Recognition Program.

If you are passionate about driving continuous improvement and creating positive change, we want to hear from you. Apply today and help make a difference at Endeavour Foundation.
Endeavour Foundation encourages applications from people of all ages, nationalities, abilities, and cultures. This includes Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, CALD (Culturally and Linguistically Diverse), the LGBTQI+ community, and people with disability. We value inclusivity and are committed to adjusting our recruitment process to ensure accessibility and support of an applicant's needs.
